channel.title: bm crashing in level 6
channel.description: hey guys, first of all i want to congratulate you on this awesome project, it must have been a lot of work but the result is truely amazing! until now, i've had a lot of fun with bm :slight_smile: unfortunately, it keeps crashing in level 6 always at the same spot. it's where you have to turn on the huge fan in order to get into a small air pit. i activate the fan and it starts turning faster and faster for about 5 secs or so and then the game sends me back to windows with the notification that hl2.exe isn't responding anymore. i use an intel i3-370M with an intel HD Graphics (pretty lame i know :stuck_out_tongue: ). the game is installed in the proper direction and i tried it with the lowest possisble graphic settings but it keeps crashing :frowning: hope u can help me... hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_18T16_5_2C0.mdmp (85 KB)

item.title: bm crashing in level 6
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Make sure all the wooden crates and other physics objects are out of that room before you start the fan, some computers can’t handle the physics.

I think changing steam.inf APPID=109 might also fix this, but I am not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: bm crashing in level 6
item.dc:creator: Cleptomaniac
item.description:
hey guys,
first of all i want to congratulate you on this awesome project, it must have been a lot of work but the result is truely amazing! until now, i’ve had a lot of fun with bm
unfortunately, it keeps crashing in level 6 always at the same spot. it’s where you have to turn on the huge fan in order to get into a small air pit. i activate the fan and it starts turning faster and faster for about 5 secs or so and then the game sends me back to windows with the notification that hl2.exe isn’t responding anymore.
i use an intel i3-370M with an intel HD Graphics (pretty lame i know ). the game is installed in the proper direction and i tried it with the lowest possisble graphic settings but it keeps crashing hope u can help me…
hl2_4104_crash_2012_9_18T16_5_2C0.mdmp (85 KB)
